is there a way that the system gets connected to the network before the log-in password is entered ?
install wicd, it will run at boot and give wireless earlier than the network manager
network manager only works after login, if you want the network working right from boot, wicd will do that
you edit settings by running it from Applications->Internet->Wicd
wicd settings has nothing to enable so that it gets connected at boot before password entry
It happens like that automatically for any connection you enable for all users
how do I totally remove wicd ?
as after I installed it i did not select all accounts
then 'sudo apt-get remove wicd'  followed by 'sudo apt-get install wicd'
is there a way to remove wicd with all its files ?
purge does a remove, then also cleans any config files left behind by remove
